videoData.title: How agri-robotics will change the food you eat
videoData.socialTitle: How agri-robotics will change the food you eat

nodes.whoTheyAre: Katherine James is a computer scientist whose research centres on machine vision solutions to biological challenges, with applications in both the conservation and agricultural space. She has presented at conferences, published papers and is currently pursuing her PhD at the University of Lincoln in high-throughput phenotyping.

videoData.description: Agricultural robotics and artificial intelligence are changing how we farm, from the day-to-day practices to big-picture planning. Computer scientist Katherine James explains why using robots to identify the optimal traits in our crops could change how and what we eat for the better.
videoData.socialDescription: Agricultural robotics and artificial intelligence are changing how we farm, from the day-to-day practices to big-picture planning. Computer scientist Katherine James explains why using robots to identify the optimal traits in our crops could change how and what we eat for the better.
